relevant_communication: The VU University Medical Centre on a regular basis organises seminars that broaden and expand on the knowledge on European policy within the organisation. goals__remit: The VU University Medical Centre (Stichting VUmc), established in 1964, is one of the leading academic centres in the Netherlands and focuses its core activities on healthcare, research and education. The medical centre treats over 150.000 patients annually, has 2.500 students enrolled in its educational programs. Overall, in 2013, VUmc was awarded a total of 80,3 M€ in external research funding. In 2014, VUmc published 2.913 international scientific articles. In that year, VUmc also has produced 487 professional publications/reports/book chapters. Between 100 and 150 PhD students graduate each year. VUmc increasingly adopts a multidisciplinary approach to care: consultation, diagnosis, treatment and result can be completed in a single visit to the clinic or outpatient department. VUmc research is strongly translational: from bench to bedside to society. The studies of VUmc focus on discovering, testing, implementing and disseminating new insights and on enhancing health care. In its scientific endeavours, approximately 700 full-time research staff help it to maintain a nationally and internationally competitive position in its fields of specialization.
